text: was a very old province of Japan, in the area of Hizen and Higo provinces.Satow, Ernest. (1874). "The Geography of Japan," Transactions of the Asiatic Society of Japan, Vol. 1-2, p. 34. It was sometimes called . The boundaries of this ancient entity are within Nagasaki (without Tsushima and Iki), Saga and Kumamoto prefectures.; Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Hizen" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 338; "Higo" at p. 310. ==History== The history of the province started and ended before the Taihō Code was established at the beginning of the 8th century. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan ==Notes== ==Other websites == * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Former provinces of Japan Category:Nagasaki Prefecture Category:Saga Prefecture Category:Kumamoto Prefecture
title: Hi Province
